It's worth noting that the developer has released other titles as bad as this one yet at least placed more effort than this. But I still can't believe how these games get released from Greenlight when other worthy titles are stuck there forever.

reviewText: It's a puzzle game and it is very repetitive. Figure out how to use the dynamite to get all of the gold and then try to make your way back to where you started. The slow paced music doesn't help things either. I got this off of a bundle so I wasn't expecting much but the regular $2.99 going price sure doesn't look worth it.

reviewText:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/449940/



Although this game had several  negative comments, strangely none of them actually said anything about the game.  They were more concerned  about  calling those  who thought the game was okay.  I  wasn't sure whether to believe the  story the developer had posted on the  sales page, but purchased the game  anyway as I do like  platformers and it was  very cheap at only £1.99

Contrary to the  naysayers (one of which thinks anyone who likes this is  basically a simpleton) I enjoyed playing it for well over an hour.  It's pretty basic graphic wise, with a retro feel to it and there's no bells or whistles included.  The basic premise is to steal  gold from the Leprechauns dungeons (I though the  gold  looked like  golden delicious apples), picking up extra dynamite  on the way.  Once you've collected everything you then need to  escape the level through it's portal.

To access many of the gold sacks you need to blast away at the  walls and floors/platforms that block your way but the   levels become    increasingly  challenging as you progress.  The dynamite needs to be used sparingly; even with the extra sticks  Care needs to be taken when using  the dynamite when  destroying walls  to gain access to the gold because you may destroy your only  way to  gain access to  your escape route.

For me it had everything   I needed to enjoy the game,  that is  challenging  levels (apart from the early ones), no  fuss graphics and dynamite.  :)


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CI22oaQ5Up4



I will add more   once I've played the game   for a few more  hours (maybe soon maybe much later)

reviewText:
Pretty basic platformer / puzzler game, dime a dozen really. Best part for me was the nice, unobtrusive music, although it's a bit repetitive. Goal of the game is to steal gold (which looks like apples, like so many other has pointed out) and clear path with dynamite. Since you have only limited amount of dynamite and have to return to starting position after collecting all the gold, you can't blast everything in level. With some planning you'll be able to clear enough blocks to reach all the gold, while leaving still a path back to starting position.

Graphics is pretty usual, 3d with a little bit lighting thrown in the misc. Reminded me a lot of early 2000 platformers. Controls aren't as solid as they could be, but good enough that you can navigate around the levels without too many problems. Lack of time limit makes the game perfect for relaxed playstyle and I suspect it's easy enough to start the game and play couple of levels now and then. Pace is slow and new elements aren't introduced too quickly.

Not my favourite game, and I got bored really soon. A little bit polish and it could be decent.
